code:
---
config:
    layout: elk
---
flowchart TD
    AAA(All Computer Science Topics)
    A(["Introduction to calculus and limits"])    
    A --> B(["The limit concept"])
    B --> C(["Graphical and numerical limits"]) & H(["Introduction to derivatives"])
    C --> D(["Limit laws"]) & E(["Limits at infinity and infinite limits"])
    D --> F(["Epsilon-delta definition of the limit"]) & G(["Continuity and the intermediate value theorem"]) & J(["Basic differentiation rules"]) & BB(["Sequences"])
    H --> I(["Derivatives as functions"])
    I --> J & N(["Rates of change and exponential models"]) & P(["Linear approximations"])
    J --> K(["The product and quotient rules"]) & L(["Trigonometric derivatives"]) & M(["Logarithmic and exponential derivatives"]) & O(["The chain rule"]) & S@{ label: "L'Hopitals rule" } & W(["Newton's method"])
    O --> R(["The shape of graphs and concavity"]) & Q(["Extreme values"]) & U(["Implicit differentiation"]) & AJ(["Integration by substitution"]) & AL(["Inverse trigonometric integrals"]) & AB(["Hyperbolic functions"]) & BJ(["Parametric equations"])
    K --> Q & AM(["Integration by parts"])
    L --> Q & T(["Antiderivatives"]) & BH(["Taylor series"]) & BK(["Polar coordinates"])
    M --> Q & T & BH
    N --> V(["Related rates"]) & AA(["Introduction to integrals and area approximation"]) & AW(["Introduction to differential equations"])
    U --> V
    Q --> X(["Optimization"]) & Y(["The mean value theorem"]) & Z(["Graphing with derivatives"])
    R --> Z
    AA --> AC(["Definite integrals"])
    AC --> AD(["The fundamental theorem of calculus"]) & AE(["Area between curves"]) & AF(["Volume of solids of revolution"]) & AG(["Arc length and surface area"]) & AH(["Physical applications of integrals"]) & AR(["Numerical and table-based integration"]) & AS(["Improper integrals"]) & AU(["Advanced physical applications"]) & AV(["Economics applications"]) & AZ(["Modeling with differential equations"]) & BL(["Area and arc length in polar coordinates"])
    T --> AD & AK(["Logarithmic and exponential integrals"]) & AJ & AL & AB & AM & AN(["Trigonometric integrals"]) & AP(["Integration by partial fractions"])
    AD --> AI(["Indefinite integrals and the net change theorem"])
    AJ --> AH & AG & AO(["Trigonometric substitutions"]) & AY(["Separable differential equations"]) & BA(["Special first-order linear differential equations"]) & BL
    AK --> AH
    AN --> AO
    AP --> AQ(["Integration strategies"])
    AO --> AQ
    AM --> AQ
    AQ --> AR & AS & AU & AV
    AS --> AT(["Probability applications"])
    AW --> AX(["Direction fields and Euler's method"]) & AY & BA
    AY --> AZ
    BB --> BC(["Series"])
    BC --> BD(["Convergence and divergence"])
    BD --> BE(["Comparison tests"]) & BF(["The ratio and root tests"]) & BG(["Alternating series"]) & BH
    BH --> BI(["Power series and functions"])
    BK --> BL & BM(["Conic sections"])
    BJ --> BM
    A --> C & D & E
    B --> D & F & E & G & I & AA & AC & AD & AS & BB
    C --> F & G & BB
    D --> L & M & S & BC & BD & BE & BF & BG
    H --> O & W
    I --> Q & Y & R & W & AD & AW & AX & BJ
    J --> U & V & Q & R & Z & X & T & AG & AB & AL & AM & BH & BJ & BK & BM
    O --> V & Z & X & AG
    K --> Z & X
    L --> Z & X & AN & AO & BL
    M --> Z & X & AK
    N --> AI & AH & AU & AV & AZ
    AC --> AT
    T --> AO & AQ & AR & AY & BA & AI
    AJ --> AQ & AU & AV
    AQ --> AT
    AW --> AZ
    BC --> BE & BF & BG & BH & BI
    BD --> BI
    S@{ shape: stadium}

    classDef limits stroke:#377eb8,font-size:18
    classDef limits-ghost stroke:#377eb80D,fill:#377eb80D,color:#d3d3d3,font-size:18
    classDef limits-pre stroke:#377eb866,fill:#377eb866,font-size:18
    classDef limits-direct stroke:#377eb8,fill:#377eb8A6,stroke-width:4px,font-size:18
   
    style AAA fill:#4daf4a99,stroke:#4daf4a,font-size:26

repo_description: Calculus Connections Explorer is an interactive web-based visualization tool designed to help teachers and students understand how core calculus concepts connect to topics across computer science and
